properties.Name: L. Chad Basin
properties.Formation: Formed by tectonic and climatic changes, Lake Chad was once a vast lake but has shrunk significantly due to climate change and overuse of water.
properties.Flooding: Seasonal flooding is crucial for agriculture and fisheries, but heavy rainfall leads to too much flooding causing loss of life and property

properties.Name: The Sudd Wetland
properties.Formation: This massive wetland forms when the White Nile enters a shallow depression as it flows from Uganda into South Sudan
properties.Flooding: The Sudd acts as a natural flood regulator, absorbing excess water. However, excessive flooding can disrupt local settlements and agriculture.

properties.Name: Wabi Shebele River Basin
properties.Formation: Originating from the Ethiopian Highlands, the river carves through arid landscapes but rarely reaches the ocean.
properties.Flooding: Seasonal floods provide water for farming, but prolonged dry spells followed by heavy rainfall leads to excessive flooding in the area

properties.Name: Inner Niger Delta
properties.Formation: Created by the slow-moving Niger River, this floodplain fills up during the rainy season and becomes a vital wetland.
properties.Flooding: Seasonal floods support fisheries, farming, and cattle grazing, but extreme floods can destroy settlements.

properties.Name: Lagos
properties.Formation: Lagos is built on coastal lowlands, with lagoons and islands formed by ocean currents and sediment deposition.
properties.Flooding: Rapid urbanization, poor drainage, and rising sea levels make Lagos highly vulnerable to coastal flooding and storm surges.

properties.Name: Accra
properties.Formation: The landscape features coastal plains, rivers, and lagoons, shaped by marine and river processes.
properties.Flooding: Heavy rainfall and poor drainage often lead to flash floods, causing damage to homes, roads, and businesses.
